rComments: Prof is knowledgeable and cool. Listen and take good notes and you will do amazing DON'T CHEAT. Totally recommend, such a fun prof and class.

Attending all the lectures and taking organized notes will get you a good grade because all of his quizzes and exams are multiple choice. The content is very interesting and he is an entertaining lecturer. He was sometimes rude to those who asked questions in class, but he did explicitly say that questions should be saved for after the lecture.
This professor, rather than trying to help students succeed, constantly looks for ways to make students fail.
Do not think this is an easy elective for easy marks. I made a terrible mistake thinking so.
Do Not think this is an easy elective course, I made some terrible mistakes.

His classes are exciting, it is like you are being told a story. However, his exams and quizzes are very stressful and we have NO time to think correctly to give out the correct answers.  Although you have to study and memorize the terms this does not matter when you have no time to answer the quiz fully.

The lectures are interesting and told like a story, HOWEVER; this doesn't matter. All of the quizzes and tests are on obscure facts that do not lead into the overall picture and are just there to prove your attendance. There is no chance to show any form of critical thought, and it is reliant on your ability to remember trivial facts.
Passive aggressive in emails, ALWAYS manages to cut off students when they are asking questions.

If you like history, you'll love Burgess. Def a very nice prof and very passionate. If you do have processing issues though, either auditory, or visual, I'd steer clear of the course as it is very hard to follow lectures in one shot. I found myself rewatching lectures so many times, not because it's hard content, but because it is hard to follow.

The class itself is interesting, you can tell the prof is passionate about what he teaches. His feedback is not great and the assignments are ridiculously difficult for a third year class. About half the class did drop it, which is not normal so take that into account as well, all over an essay proposal that feels like one of Heracles' 12 labours.

Unclear criteria for the essay made about 2/3 of the class drop. Not sure what to expect on anything. Lectures upfront but exams are super weird - some questions easy and some incredibly specific and hard. Dont expect an A+ out of this class.
Funny guy, really tough essay marker though.

Loved this class! The content was interesting and the prof was great at delivering it. It felt more like he was telling a story than teaching. Midterms were 150 marks each and composed of topics he covered in class. Take detailed notes on what he says in class and you'll do well. If you like Roman history you'll like this prof, he knows his stuff.

Prof Burgess definitely loves the material and is a fantastic lecturer... but by end of term it felt like he was frustrated with the students and it showed. Memorization heavy class with weekly quizzes, two midterms and a final, all MCQ/true-false/matching. Write down everything he says in class and use the vocabulary list to help you study!

Prof Burgess was vey passionate about the course and made the lectures very interesting. However, perhaps due to the transition to online class, he seemed to really dislike the class this year. Emails to the class were always written with a hostile tone, and I mean EXTREMELY hostile. Easy class if you keep your head down and avoid contact with him.

His tests are extremely specific and he makes you memorize a lot of information (even some that you would have never thought of jotting down during the lecture). No textbook and the slideshows he puts in class have single words on them so you need to write VERY thorough notes. He gave a lot of unnecessary attitude over email when asked for help too
Class Prof. Hilarious and engaging lectures. If you put in the work you'll get an easy A.

Hilarious guy. When we switched to online, his lectures on Twitch still managed to be insightful and funny. Best professor and bird course at UO if you ask me. CLA1102 is a great elective if you're looking to boost your GPA.
Great guy, interesting class

One of the best professors I have come across at the University of Ottawa, Telfer professors can learn a thing or two about teaching from him.... I highly recommend taking his class (taking it with a few friends would be smart). The class is lecture heavy but it is not hard, and it is fun for a university course for sure :)

One of my favourite profs at uOttawa! He is so organized and he will respond to your emails really quickly. I loved the course format, 2 midterms, a quiz every week and a final. Very straight forward grading scale. There is no textbook but the booklet was very cheap and also helpful. Great as an elective course.
Richard is a great prof, he really cares about the subject. The course is very heavy on memorization, but he really does make very class enjoyable.
Prof Burgess is the best professor at uOttawa. Even if you're not that interested in Roman Civilization, it is still worth it to take his class. You won't regret it!!

Richard is the reason I know I made the right choice choosing uOttawa. He is so in love with his field, and it emanates. He is a clear teacher and although it is a hard subject it is so so enjoyable. I honestly cannot tell if I love Latin and should switch my degree or if I just love being taught by him.

I went to every single lecture and prof. Burgess makes the lectures very engaging and funny. Despite going to all the classes, I could not memorize the amount of material he expected us to know. Be prepared for 250+ DATE/NAME SPECIFIC multiple choice questions on the final exam.... not my style of learning

Great prof but there is A LOT of information in this course. I went to every single class during the semester, took good notes, exchanged notes with two other students and I still had trouble remembering everything. The entire class is him pretty much just word-vomiting the entirety of roman civilization and you scrambling to write it all down.

Professor Burgess is phenomenal! He makes sure all the content is easily understandable and makes lectures fun and interesting. Attending class is pretty necessary since he doesn't post any slides online, just vocabulary words. Tests and exam are all straightforward, reading over notes is pretty much all you have to do to study.
great prof, must attend classes or have a study buddy for notes, material is easy to remember b/c he has a story line
I am in love with this prof! He is just awesome. Make sure you go to all classes and literally just read your notes- easy A!

I took this as an elective in my 3rd year and it was the best choice I ever made. It's an easy class with a bit of memorization. You must attend and/or get the notes from someone else as none of the slides are found online. I recommend attending since the lectures are GREAT. He is inspiring and is hands down the best professor at U of Ottawa.

Burgess was my favourite Prof at UO and I recommend him to everyone I can. He often loves his material and gets really into it which makes learning easier. His lectures don't feel long which is great and they're always enjoyable. I'd take any of his classes I could.
Very fun and overall engaging lectures.
Legendary

Prof. Burgess' classes are enjoyable if you do the work and have a genuine interest in the topic. He does not have any slides so make sure you go to EVERY class and write quickly because he talks fast. If like me you enjoy the classics, you will learn a lot about Roman Civ and appreciate his cheesy sense of humour. Pretty cool guy, loves his craft

Richard Burgess is the model that all history teachers and professors should look up to. His lectures are incredibly interesting and engaging, while also being chock-full of information. Attend the lectures and take notes, and it's an easy pass.

I found the class to be really interesting. Be prepared to memorize a lot but it's not hard at all. He's clear and explains everything well. We had a quiz every week but it's out of 2 and you can use your notes, although it is timed (2 mins) so be ready. Tests are almost all MC, he'll put joke answers in but also trick questions.

BEST Professor I have had in 5 years of university. He is hilarious and an amazing lecturer. I actually looked forward to his lectures every week. If you study even a LITTLE bit, you'll do fine, but attending class is necessary since he doesn't use a textbook and doesn't post his notes online. Pay attention to the details!

The best professor I ever had!  Five classes later and I'm still a fan.  He goes above and beyond to help the students who truly care and work hard.  I would highly recommend taking a class with Prof. Burgess.
Absolutely Brilliant!

This was easily the BEST class I have ever taken at uOttawa over the four years that I have been here. Prof. Burgess made this class so interesting and I was excited to go to each one. I can't believe I'm saying this but I wish the semester had lasted longer because I loved every second of it! I took a lot of class notes but it was worth it!

Very interesting lectures. You'll need to go to every class and write EVERYTHING he says (I found you had to type because he talks fast). If you study your notes for a few hours his test are extremely easy.

Very amazing prof, he is clearly passionate with his work! The whole course feels like a movie (he tells everything like a story and it sticks in your head). Still, memorization is KEY. Use the dates to memorize the 'history'. Write down EVERYTHING. Quiz (one every week) consisting of TWO questions (easy). No short/long questions on tests. TAKE HIM

Burgess is the best prof at uottawa! he's always enthusiastic about his class and while he does speak fast, he has no problem with you stopping him to ask a question and is always super nice about it. As long as you take good notes, you'll do great! his tests were great, full of funny references  and very fair if you studied the material well.

Prof Burgess was awesome all around.  Only issue I found was that he spoke too quickly to get all of his notes down and it IS MANDATORY to get ALL of them down.  He will test on little things you might not think are important  to write down.  Otherwise, hilarious lectures and if you're interested in the subject it's for sure worth taking.

Best class I've taken to date. This was an elective for me, but man it was such an interesting class. Show up to class, take notes on your computer by typing everything he says, study the notes, and you're guaranteed an A grade. Burgess is an awesome prof and sets his students up for success. I'd definitely take another class with him! Too good!!

One of the best professors I've ever had, hands down. He definitely knows how to connect with his students. I'd say attendance is mandatory, considering that if you miss class you'll probably have a hard time passing. The tests are really fun too; they're long, but keep in mind this course has no homework besides weekly quizzes.

Don't take his class unless you are actually interested in the subject. He does not have slides, just talks and you have to take notes. Makes you memorize an entire map and dates. His tests are way too long.
Very entertaining, clear, and informative. A tough class but not impossible if you make an effort. Probably my favourite teacher so far!
He is the best. You will likely get a few white hair at the end of the semester, but that's because your brain activity will have tripled over the course of four months.

Great prof but you need to WORK to do well in his classes. He expects a lot of his students but you will never have a better Greek professor. Thanks to him, most of us understand the language inside and out. It's worth working your butt off for this class!

Awesome. He very clearly knows his stuff and is very clear on what you need to know and for when. He makes a lot of references to Doctor Who, Firefly, Game of Thrones, and other awesome shows (some names show up on midterms for MC). He makes the course fun! Toga day and Sword Day were awesome. Take any course with Burgess!
Amazing. End of story.
by far the best professor i have had in my 4 years of post-secondary. he is funny, engaging, very knowledgable and always makes class interesting.

Hilarious and stimulating professor. Uses pop-culture references in lectures and makes it very interactive on certain topics in the course. As long as you takes notes and study decently then a good mar is not hard to accomplish at all.

Great class to take as an elective. The class was interesting and relaxing and it helps take your mind off other intense classes. As long as you go to class you should have a good grade. Would recommend.

Fantastic professor; fantastic course. If you attend all classes, and take notes well, you should have no problem getting an A. He's a great speaker and really works hard to keep the class informative and fun. It's a lot of information to remember, but if you study what he says, you should have no excuse for failing.
This is the BEST prof I've ever had. He drilled mountains of information into the heads of 400 students effortlessly. You will get an A+ if you go to class with your eyes open.
A very entertaining and interesting prof. Highly recommended

A little nerdy but very enthusiastic and funny professor. He knows how to make his students laugh and how to explain this well. Aslong as you take really good notes (including the random references to the coursepack and picture slides) you can ace this class easily. Learned so much in this class and loved every lecture!
Really funny guy! Worth taking the class even if you're not studying Classics.

A gem of a prof. He's funny, he knows how to teach, and keeping a class of 400+ students engaged takes a certain amount of skill that most profs dont possess. I highly recommend taking his class no matter what your program is.
Amazing Prof! Togas, Light Sabers, and 2 percenter jokes = good times
Awesome Prof, any professor that has toga and sword days is amazing.

Amazing prof. Makes movie references in every lecture and on both midterms and the final exam. He once spent 20 minutes explaning some Roman political history Dr. Seuss-style! He's hilarious and a lot of fun. No textbook. You just have to go to class and actually listen and you can get an A+ easy...Also, he brings swords to class...and a lightsaber

amazing prof. lectures are well organized and so interactive and interesting! He is a very personable prof, very easy to talk to! He brings in funny things and does great imitations, not to mention hysterical pop culture references on the exams. Exams and midterms are tricky, but if you study what he tells you to you'll do great!TAKE THIS CLASS
Do not think this is another "easy elective" you have to work hard to keep the marks high.

Blackberry Prof, replies to e-mails in 2 minutes. Very etnertaining but his exams are really tricky. Gives you trick multiple chioce questions. Way too many dates, battles and way to many people to know. And you HAVE to know who fought who, where, why etc or your screwed on the exam. Overall, I would recommend this class. Not easy, but not hard.

CANNOT SAY ENOUGH!!! best prof i've ever had. Lectures are amazingly well-presented and so interesting! He knows everything about EVERYTHING, (especially Monty Python haha). I actually looked forward to going to class, and one of my friends who wasn't even in the class would often come because it was so great. I recommend roman civ 100 times over!

he's a sweet prof. dresses up in togas and tunics. brings swords to class. main fault is he is a sens fan. haha. i would recommend this class to anyone, its easy as long as you attend and pay a bit of attention which is easy to do because he is so engaging.

I enjoyed his lectures; he is passionate about Roman Civilization - he even dressed up a couple times throughout the semester. There were 400 people in my class, so the scantron machine does the marking. The midterms are based on the lectures so just go to class an you'll be fine.

This prof is amazing! Funny and makes everything he talks about interesting. I was always looking forward to his. Only downside is that you have to take a lot of notes and remember a lot of dates, but who cares, everything is so interesting. Even his exams are funny! And somewhat easy, as they are all multiple choice. Loved this prof!
Very funny and knowledgeable - the perfect combination of qualities.
wonderfully engaging. funny and clearly loves what he's teaching

He is just extremely nerdy and funny, and very easy to listen to. Get someone to study with! That way, if you miss a class, you won't miss 2 pages worth of lecture notes you'll need for the exam. There are no slide shows or anything really useful on web ct... I'd take another class by him any time.

Great professor!! He was very interesting, I definitely enjoyed the lectures and the slideshows. He was very funny (first course where I laughed while taking an exam because he had put some joke answers to multiple choice questions). Make sure to attend class, because a lot is covered and there are no overheads. LOTS to remember for exams too.

R. W. BURGESS IS ROMAN CIVILIZATION! BOOM!!  Enjoyable lectures, very informative. Exams can be tough, however, if you attend the classes, take good notes and review them after every class.. then, your laughing! Don't fear asking him for help, very approachable. Movie nights he encourages you to come to are actually GREAT! Had him Winter 2007. :)

This professor was great! He was straight forward from the get go as to what would be expected to students. Teaching styles differ(verbal, visual etc) which is nice for those who learn in specific ways. Lots and lots of examples, funny stories, rumours etc. A little jumpy from Life to History of Romans, but pay attention and its no problem at all.

Horrible lecture style. Lectures were all over the place jumping from on thing to the next. We did not have a textbook so it was very difficult if you missed something in a lecture. Exams were hard.. made us memorize abour 100 dates and 100 places on a map!! could have been way more interested if taught  more organized way w/ textbook.

awesome prof hes so funny yet i really learn alot in his class. makes the information useful like dressing in a toga and playing with swords lol. the tests can be a bit tough, he expects you to know alot of info but puts funny questions on them. great prof, great class you should definately take it if possible.
Extremely funny as well as educational! You won't be disapointed. He is very good at what he does. I love it when Proffs express themselves to the students so well.
Very funny.
He is an awesome prof very knowledgable and helpful.  His Roman history class is great and he is the best ancient language teacher I have ever had (comparing Latin and Greek).

Professor Burgess is an amazing prof. I've never had so much fun in any class. Fair marker and exams, tests, assignments, ect... are reasonable. Makes classes really interesting and is very knowledgable. Best Prof i've had yet!
A really fun, interested and informative prof who conveyed sooo much information in only one term!  Tests were fair if well prepared for.

Best class ever! He was very knowledgeable, funny and when it came time to study, I remembered everything he said! The tests were very easy and there was no paper. The exam was actually fun...I got to write about Paris Hilton. In short, I loved this class and this prof!

Although it was a lot of notes to take in class, prof Burgess made class very enjoyable with funny anecdotes we could relate to and I don't think I've ever had more fun writing a final exam essay in my life than that which I wrote for his class

I have never met such a self-posessed individual.  He was totally unhelpful, expects all his students to be A+ students and paces classes at that rate.  He was incredibly rude to all francophone students in his greek classes.
I loved this guy, hilarious, made roman history interesting, and lectured well. Its a heavy course, but I still loved it and got a A.

I would like him to stop bithching about other profs, and saying we are in a useless program and bad uni... I've already paid my 5000$: save it please.  And maybe it would be a better school if teachers, like him, helped students out when they asked.
Demanding, but fair, as long as you're willing to do the work & don't skip class.  Very Star Trek obsessed!  (Not that I have a problem with that!)
He wears a toga to class.  what more can you ask for?
he is one of the best teachers I've ever had. his knowledge of roman history is absolutely amazing, and he teaches the course in such a way that I'm able to remember pretty much everything he says.
Awesome prof. Knows everything about anything related to Rome! Best prof I've ever had! And really sexy too!
Knows his stuff. Very geeky, in a good way. Lectures are easy to follow. Very animated guy, makes for an interesting class. Good class :)
Best prof in the University.  He loves Lord of the Rings...what else can you ask for?  Plus, he makes reference to Gladiator.
Lectures well, but unhelpful and never has time for you.
Absolutely horrible. My whole class had a difficult time and he wasn't helpful at all, no matter how hard you worked. We went from a class of A and B students to C's and D's.
He makes you work, but is fair, and is a clear and helpful teacher. If you're a christian, be prepared to be frustrated by some of his statements. Throws in lots of interesting tidbits of history!
I found him an absolutely brilliant professor.  Lots of information to cram in, but he teaches it well, and is always available to help.  The toga and GI Roman were definate bonuses :)
He's tough as hell, but it pays off big time!  We don't regret getting him now.
Not very helpful at all.
This class is hard!
funny, interesting, direct, enthusiastic
No Comments
Turns lectures into stories, and he isn't afraid to wear a toga to class!!!
